title: BKM Wealth Management LLC Raises Position in Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL
summary: BKM Wealth Management LLC significantly increased its stake in Alphabet Inc. ($GOOGL) by 894.9% in the third quarter, making it their 20th largest holding. This comes as Alphabet's market capitalization approaches $4 trillion, driven by strong quarterly earnings and investor enthusiasm around its AI investments and Google Cloud segment. Despite substantial insider selling, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Alphabet, with an average price target of $326.31.

title: Baker Ellis Asset Management LLC Acquires 9,134 Shares of Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL
summary: Baker Ellis Asset Management LLC significantly increased its stake in Alphabet Inc. (NASDAQ:GOOGL) by 41.9% in the third quarter, purchasing an additional 9,134 shares, bringing its total holding to 30,924 shares valued at $7.52 million. This move positions Alphabet as the firm's 29th largest holding, representing about 0.9% of its investment portfolio. Despite recent insider selling, Wall Street analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Alphabet, with an average price target of $326.31, supported by the company's strong AI momentum and Google Cloud's growth potential.

title: Alphabet Inc. $GOOGL Shares Sold by Atwater Malick LLC
summary: Atwater Malick LLC reduced its stake in Alphabet (GOOGL) by 3.5%, selling 3,030 shares, though the stock remains its third-largest holding. Additionally, Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai and Director John L. Hennessy sold shares, contributing to over $57 million in insider sales within three months. Despite insider sales and competition concerns from OpenAI in the ad market, analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating with an average target price of $326.31, amid strong AI momentum and Cloud growth.

title: F5 NGINXaaS for Google Cloud advances cloud-native application delivery and security
summary: F5 has launched NGINXaaS for Google Cloud, a fully managed, cloud-native application delivery-as-a-service solution developed in collaboration with Google Cloud. This offering consolidates load balancing, security, and observability to simplify operations and reduce costs for modern and containerized applications. It aims to bridge industry gaps by combining F5's Application Delivery and Security Platform capabilities with Google Cloud's ecosystem, enabling enterprises to deliver seamless performance, achieve greater visibility, and protect cloud applications with robust security features.

title: Ackman Targets Howard Hughes Holdings for Growth, Aiming for Berkshire Hathaway Model
summary: Bill Ackman is acquiring a controlling stake in Howard Hughes Holdings with the aim of transforming it into a diversified holding company, similar to Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway model, particularly focusing on insurance. This strategic move is anticipated to significantly boost Howard Hughes' market value. The article also touches upon the strong performance of other companies like Alphabet in AI, Brookfield Corp.'s asset management revenue, and Uber's user growth.

title: Quantum Computing Stocks To Watch Now - January 19th
summary: MarketBeat has identified IonQ (IONQ), D-Wave Quantum (QBTS), and Quantum Computing (QUBT) as the top quantum computing stocks experiencing high dollar trading volume as of January 19th. These companies are viewed as speculative, long-horizon investments due to the emerging nature of quantum technology. IonQ offers access to its quantum systems via major cloud platforms, D-Wave provides a quantum computer and cloud access services, and Quantum Computing Inc. specializes in integrated-photonics quantum products.

title: Wells Fargo Says You Should Buy the Dip in Broadcom Stock
summary: Wells Fargo analysts have upgraded Broadcom (AVGO) to "Overweight" from "Equal-weight" and increased their price target due to growing confidence in the company's execution and increasing visibility into future catalysts. This decision follows a recent 4.2% dip in Broadcom's stock, which Wells Fargo views as an attractive entry point for investors. The positive outlook is primarily driven by accelerating AI momentum, with Wells Fargo significantly raising its AI semiconductor revenue projections for 2026 and 2027, anticipating substantial year-over-year growth.

title: Gartner: Global AI spending to reach $2.5 trillion in 2026
summary: Gartner projects global AI spending to hit $2.52 trillion in 2026, marking a 44% increase from the previous year, largely driven by investments in AI infrastructure, particularly AI-optimized servers. The report suggests that AI is currently in the "trough of disillusionment" and its adoption will depend on proven business value and integration through existing software vendors rather than standalone ventures. Significant scaling in larger organizations will occur when ROI becomes more predictable.

title: Wells Fargo Says You Should Buy the Dip in Broadcom Stock
summary: Wells Fargo analysts have upgraded Broadcom (AVGO) to "Overweight" from "Equal-weight" after a recent dip in its stock price, viewing it as a buying opportunity. The firm significantly raised its 2026 and 2027 estimates for Broadcom, driven by accelerating AI semiconductor momentum and a strategic partnership with Alphabet. Despite a hefty valuation, Wall Street maintains a "Strong Buy" consensus rating for AVGO stock, with a mean price target suggesting a potential upside of 29%.

title: Palmetto Grain Brokerage -
summary: Apple (AAPL) is facing regulatory scrutiny in India over antitrust concerns, with a potential fine of up to $38 billion, though the company is challenging the legality of the penalty framework in court. Despite this, Apple posted strong Q4 2025 earnings and is being highlighted by analysts as a top AI play for 2026, especially after partnering with Google Gemini for Siri, indicating a clear AI strategy. Analysts have a "Moderate Buy" rating on AAPL stock, with some, like Dan Ives of Wedbush, setting a high price target of $350.

title: BlackRock: Why AI Investment will Evolve in 2026
summary: BlackRock's latest Investment Directions report indicates a shift in AI investment strategy for 2026, moving away from a primary focus on big tech companies towards energy providers and grid infrastructure. While AI remains central, investors are now prioritizing the foundational elements that support AI's scaling and long-term sustainability, driven by rising power costs and concentration risk concerns. The report suggests a focus on physical infrastructure and private markets to fund the necessary energy capacity for AI's continued expansion.

title: ZEGA Investments LLC Trims Stake in Alphabet Inc. $GOOG

Despite this reduction, significant bullish sentiment, analyst upgrades, and AI-related catalysts like Apple's adoption of Google's Gemini have pushed Alphabet's valuation to nearly $4 trillion. The company, led by CEO Hock Tan, reported record-breaking financial results in FY2025, with significant growth in AI-related revenue and strong free cash flow. Despite potential risks like customer concentration and the VMware transition, Broadcom's dominant market position and disciplined management make it a key player in the technology landscape.

title: The Dual-Engine Era: A 2026 Deep-Dive Research Report on Microsoft (MSFT)

The report concludes that Microsoft has solidified its role in enterprise tech with its Agent-based ecosystem, despite significant investment costs, emphasizing the importance of monitoring cloud margins and "Agent 365" adoption.

title: RBC Capital Retains an Outperform Rating on Walmart Inc. (WMT)
summary: RBC Capital has reiterated an Outperform rating on Walmart Inc. (WMT) and increased its price target to $126 from $123, citing constructive management sentiment following a meeting with the company's EVP of AI Acceleration. Goldman Sachs also reaffirmed a Buy rating with a $121 price target, highlighting Walmart's positive outlook on AI and potential partnerships with Google and OpenAI. Both firms emphasize the company's strong prospects through increased AI integration and market strength.

title: 'Big Short' Investor Michael Burry Sides With Ben Affleck On AI Critique, Calls It Fundamentally 'Not Reliable'
summary: Michael Burry, known from "The Big Short," has voiced his agreement with Ben Affleck's skepticism about AI, particularly its lack of reliability. Affleck argued that current large language models reflect only the "average" and are incapable of genuine human creativity, casting doubt on their ability to generate meaningful artistic works or entirely produce films. Burry, who has also been critical of the AI sector, warned of an impending AI bubble and bet against NVIDIA, accusing some leading AI companies of suspicious revenue recognition.

title: Gary Black Says Tesla Won't Be 'Winner-Take-All' As Far As Autonomy Is Concerned, But A 'Blackberry Moment' Is Coming For OEMs Not In The Race
summary: Investor Gary Black predicts a "Blackberry moment" for traditional automakers (OEMs) who fail to invest in unsupervised autonomous driving, akin to Blackberry's decline with the rise of touch screen smartphones. While he acknowledges the importance of autonomy, Black doubts Tesla will be the sole winner in this space. He also questioned the low adoption rate of Tesla's Full Self-Driving (FSD) technology, which will soon transition to a subscription-only model to boost usage and meet Elon Musk's ambitious pay package milestones.

title: Gary Black Says Tesla Won't Be 'Winner-Take-All' As Far As Autonomy Is Concerned, But A 'Blackberry Moment' Is Coming For OEMs Not In The Race
summary: Investor Gary Black predicts a "Blackberry moment" for traditional automakers who fail to invest in unsupervised autonomous driving, cautioning that Tesla will not be the sole winner in this space. He questions the low adoption rate of Tesla's Full Self-Driving (FSD) technology, which will soon transition to a subscription-only model to boost usage. Black highlights that while Tesla scores well in momentum, the future of autonomy will likely involve multiple players, not just one dominant force.

title: Roth Capital Reaffirms Buy on Radian (RDN) as Inigo Deal Advances Specialty Insurance Push
summary: Roth Capital has reaffirmed its Buy rating on Radian Group Inc. (RDN) and maintained a $45 price target, citing the company's planned acquisition of Inigo Limited as a key move into specialty insurance. The firm raised its 2025 EPS forecast for Radian following stronger-than-expected Q3 results. Radian expects the Inigo deal to close in February 2026, broadening its market position from a US mortgage insurer to a diversified global specialty insurer.

title: What Does Wall Street Think About Krystal Biotech (KRYS)?
summary: Krystal Biotech (KRYS) is considered a strong buy by hedge funds, with Citi recently raising its price target to $336. The company reported strong preliminary unaudited Q4 and full-year 2025 financial results for its product VYJUVEKÂ®, with Q4 net product revenue expected between $106 million and $107 million, and full-year revenue between $388 million and $389 million. While acknowledging KRYS's potential, the article also promotes other AI investment opportunities.

title: Alphabet Class A vs Class C: Key Differences Explained
summary: Alphabet Inc. has two publicly traded stock classes, GOOGL (Class A) and GOOG (Class C), which offer identical economic exposure but differ in voting rights. Class A shares provide one vote per share, mainly appealing to institutional investors valuing formal governance participation, while Class C shares have no voting rights and are preferred by passive investors and traders focused purely on price performance. The existence of these classes, alongside the non-public super-voting Class B shares held by founders, allows Alphabet to maintain strategic control while accessing public capital markets.

title: Netflix-Warner deal drama sets up big week for Communication Services stocks as XLC ETF slips
summary: The Communication Services Select Sector SPDR Fund (XLC) dropped 0.9% on Friday, mainly due to losses in Alphabet and Disney, as Wall Street anticipates a busy week after the Martin Luther King Jr. Day holiday. Investors are focused on Netflix's upcoming earnings report, its pursuit of Warner Bros' streaming assets, and Paramount Skydance's competing bid, alongside the finalization of Frontier's merger with Verizon. The sector faces potential volatility due to its concentrated holdings and regulatory scrutiny over major deals, with political risk also playing a role.

title: Google stock price: GOOG faces antitrust pause bid â what to watch before Tuesdayâs open

Analysts maintain an "Overweight" rating for MSFT with a consensus price target around $630, while institutional investors have adjusted their positions.

title: Rackspace Email Hosting Prices to Surge 700% Starting March 2026
summary: Rackspace Technology is dramatically increasing its email hosting prices by up to 700% starting March 2026, causing widespread outrage among customers and resellers. This strategic shift, aimed at covering infrastructure expenses, is leading many users to consider migrating to competitors like Google Workspace or Microsoft 365. The controversial move highlights evolving pressures within the cloud market and raises questions about customer loyalty versus profitability.

title: Waymo, Tesla Robotaxi Rival WeRide's Fleet Surpasses 1,000 AVs, Boasts Driverless Operations In 3 Cities: 'Tens Of Thousandsâ¦'
summary: Chinese robotaxi company WeRide Inc. has announced its global autonomous vehicle fleet has surpassed 1,000 robotaxis, with fully driverless operations in Beijing, Guangzhou, and Abu Dhabi. The company aims to have tens of thousands of robotaxis by 2030 and has also integrated booking through China's WeChat app. This expansion comes as rivals like Alphabet-backed Waymo and Tesla continue to develop their own robotaxi services, with Waymo also expanding its fleet and Tesla working towards its driverless goals.

title: Google Continues Its Massive Power Grab
summary: Google is aggressively securing massive amounts of electricity through new power purchase agreements, including nearly 1.2 gigawatts with Clearway Energy Group. This proactive strategy is driven by the soaring energy demands of its data centers, particularly those supporting Google Cloud and Google Gemini AI services, which consume significantly more power than traditional operations. These deals with companies like Clearway, Brookfield Renewable, and NextEra Energy, aim to ensure a stable and cost-effective power supply for Google's expanding AI and cloud infrastructure, while also benefiting the energy providers through steady cash flow and dividend growth.

title: Strong Analyst Sentiment on Microsoft (MSFT) Despite Price Target Cuts and Heavy AI Spend
